definition: to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]
separation of powers for checks and balances

sentences.english: This separation of powers between the Executive and the Legislature is part of the constitution's checks and balances.
sentences.chinese: 这是行政立法两权分立相互制衡的宪政架构。

sentences.english: Media can play role ensuring good governance and accountability.
sentences.chinese: 媒体可发挥制衡作用，确保良政治理和问责性。

sentences.english: The world hopes the U.S. will remain a counterweight to China.
sentences.chinese: 世界希望美国依旧可以是中国的制衡力量。

sentences.english: Even former US enemy Vietnam looks to the US to counter-balance them.
sentences.chinese: 就算是曾经美国的敌人越南也偏向美国来制衡中国。

sentences.english: Thirdly, we should make use of ownership balance reasonably.
sentences.chinese: 最后建议上市公司合理利用股权制衡的治理作用。

sentences.english: Checks and balances are the theme in the political arena, while management and controlling are the routine in the business world.
sentences.chinese: 在政治界谈的是制衡，商业界则是管理及控制。

sentences.english: We have checks and balances in place to ensure transparent and accountable management.
sentences.chinese: 我们建立了制衡制度，确保透明和负责任的管理。

sentences.english: Markets have moods and biases that need to be counterbalanced.
sentences.chinese: 市场喜怒无常且有成见和偏爱，需要予以制衡。

sentences.english: These and other checks and balances ensure that no single branch of government exercises too much power.
sentences.chinese: 这种制衡关系使政府的任何一个部门都无法独揽大权。

sentences.english: The checks and balances in the US system still work.
sentences.chinese: 美国政治体系中的权力制衡仍在发挥作用。

sentences.english: Chapter 3 is the model establishment of check-and-balance system of fund manager.
sentences.chinese: 第三章基金管理人制衡机制的模型设置。

sentences.english: The spirit ofcheckes and balances advocates that powers should restrict mutually, in order to avoidabusing.
sentences.chinese: 在波利比阿那里，他把混合精神与制衡精神相结合。

sentences.english: To realize the balance state, however, seperation of powers and checks and balances are effectual methods.
sentences.chinese: 而要实现这种平衡，分权制衡便是一种有效的手段。

sentences.english: But regulators see the companies as something of competitive counterweights.
sentences.chinese: 但监管机构认为，两大公司的竞争能够相互制衡。

sentences.english: Where are companies like Blackwater held to any conceivable check and balance that I learned in civics class?
sentences.chinese: 哪里还有我在公民学课上学到的制衡作用？

sentences.english: Corporate governance relates to the check and balance of stakeholders' rights and obligations.
sentences.chinese: 公司治理涉及各种利益相关者责权利的划分和制衡。

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
separation of powers for checks and balances
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
(lit.) to hold sb by the elbow/(fig.) to hold back/to impede/to handicap
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
